snippet: New rules, widely believed to be aimed at WeChat, are intended to curb the sharing of unauthorized political news and information.
abstract: China imposes new restrictions on country's most popular mobile instant messaging services, including rules meant to curb sharing of unauthorized political news and information; regulations are believed to be aimed at popular app WeChat, which now has nearly 400 million active users in a typical month..

byline.contributor: Wang Shanshan and Chen Jiehao contributed research.

lead_paragraph: New rules, widely believed to be aimed at WeChat, are intended to curb the sharing of unauthorized political news and information.

headline.main: China Moves to Rein In Messaging for Mobile
headline.print_headline: China Moves to Rein in Messaging for Mobile
